security_audit.summary: This skill contains only static documentation files extracted from PostgreSQL official documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond reading its own markdown files. Purely a reference skill for AI assistants.

content.user_title: Write PostgreSQL queries and design databases
content.value_statement: This skill provides comprehensive PostgreSQL documentation to help AI assistants write SQL queries, design database schemas, and manage PostgreSQL systems. It includes reference materials for connection handling, SQL syntax, and database administration.
actual_capabilities: Provides PostgreSQL SQL syntax and query examples
Documents database connection functions and parameters
Explains database design patterns and best practices
Covers performance tuning and optimization techniques
Details administrative commands and user management
limitations: Does not execute SQL queries or connect to databases directly
Does not modify system configuration or database files
Requires user to have PostgreSQL installed for actual database operations
Cannot access or modify external databases without user action

use_cases.title: Manage PostgreSQL servers

use_cases.title: Design database schemas

prompt_templates.title: Complex join

prompt_templates.title: Performance
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me optimize this slow PostgreSQL query using EXPLAIN ANALYZE and indexing strategies

prompt_templates.title: Database design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a PostgreSQL schema for an e-commerce system with users, products, and orders tables

output_examples.input: Write a query to find the top 5 customers by total order amount
output: SELECT c.customer_id, c.name, SUM(o.amount) as total_spent
JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id

best_practices: Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection attacks
Create appropriate indexes on columns used in WHERE and JOIN clauses
Use EXPLAIN ANALYZE to understand query execution plans
Avoid SELECT * and only retrieve the columns you need
anti_patterns: Using string concatenation to build SQL queries
Running expensive queries in loops without pagination
Neglecting to vacuum and analyze tables regularly
Storing sensitive data without encryption or proper access controls

faq.question: What PostgreSQL versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers PostgreSQL 18 and later versions. Many examples also apply to earlier versions 13-17.

faq.question: Does this skill execute SQL queries?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides documentation and examples. You must execute queries using your own PostgreSQL installation.

faq.question: Can I connect to remote databases?
faq.answer: This skill documents connection parameters but cannot make connections. You must configure connections in your application.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only reads static documentation files and does not access any external data or systems.

faq.question: Why is my query running slowly?
faq.answer: Check for missing indexes, use EXPLAIN ANALYZE to identify bottlenecks, and consider query optimization techniques.

faq.question: How does this compare to other database skills?
faq.answer: This skill provides official PostgreSQL documentation. Use MySQL or SQLite skills for those databases instead.
